titleStmt.title: Londons defiance to Rome a perfect narrative of the magnificent procession and solemn burning of the Pope at Temple-Barr, Nov. 17th, 1679 (being the coronation-day of that never-to-be-forgotten Princess, Queen Elizabeth) with a description of the order, rich habits, extraordinary fire-works, songs, and general tryumphs attending that illustrious ceremony.
titleStmt.author: Settle, Elkanah, 1648-1724.

titleStmt.title: Londons defiance to Rome a perfect narrative of the magnificent procession and solemn burning of the Pope at Temple-Barr, Nov. 17th, 1679 (being the coronation-day of that never-to-be-forgotten Princess, Queen Elizabeth) with a description of the order, rich habits, extraordinary fire-works, songs, and general tryumphs attending that illustrious ceremony.
titleStmt.author: Settle, Elkanah, 1648-1724.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Elkanah Settle. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
